body.name: Libman 211 Extra Large Precision Angle Broom with Recycled Broom Fibers
body.stockDetail: Only 6 left in stock - order soon.
features: Widest Sweeping surface precisely cut to reach under tight corners indoors and outdoors
Flagged broom fibers result in more debris moved with every sweep
Longer life than your typical broom, with environmentally friendly, recycled broom fibers made from water bottles
55" steel broom handle with a 10.5" polypropylene molded broom block and 15" sweeping surface.
Quality made in the USA since 1896
body.description: Make a clean sweep with Libman Extra Large Precision Angle Broom. Our widest household angle broom makes cleaning your floor surfaces simple. Specifically designed for wood, concrete, tile, and linoleum, the sturdy steel handle and one-piece resin block delivers guaranteed quality. The 15" sweeping surface and angled shape of the fibers ensures that you can cover under cabinets and around tight corners much easier than a traditional straight-edge broom. The broom fibers are made from recycled plastic in U.S. manufacturing plants.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Works great in our house which is mostly tile. Collects the dirt and doesn’t drop little bits as you sweep. Good width for household brooming. The dust pan is good too….stays in place and doesn’t allow crumbs to go under it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It's a Clean Sweep
reviews.reviewText: I bought a Libman Model 211 last year and liked it so much I just bought another one for the garage. The 211 has lots of dense bristles that efficiently capture dirt. Plus, it's made in the USA! Great broom!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2013
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars This Is One Substantial Broom Here!!
reviews.reviewText: This broom is great, as far as performance of the broom.Dirt & dust really seems to have no place to hide when this broom is brought on the case.However, I would like to warn those that have arthritis or carpal tunnel, or both that have weakness in their hands and arms that this is a heavy broom. (to me anyways, to make a very long story really short, I have rheumatoid arthritis & had carpal tunnel in both of my hands. I got to surgery for a carpal tunnel release just as fast as I could, but it was too late. The problem was severe & even with months of P.T. for my hands I still have a lot of weakness that has never gone away.)It is a great broom but heavy.The bristles are plentiful & strong.You can easily tell this is a quality broom & there seems to be no shortcuts taken in quality of the manufacturing of this broom.So if you re looking for a long lasting, high performance broom, here it is. If you are looking for a lightweight broom, I would look elsewhere.The shipping was great. I was amused when it arrived, as the bottom bristles had been sorta shrink wrapped and there were several pieces of taped on paper with my name on the broom. It did not arrive in a box, but I did not mind, as the item was not damaged & the presentation upon arrival was so funny looking.I will be buying another one of these brooms in the next little while, but I intend to look & see if another broom from the same manufacturer & line are available, maybe lighter weight.If I can find that, I will have my 5* broom.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 1, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Go for the larger broom...more space covered, less time sweeping.
reviews.reviewText: If you are like me, you've had your broom forever. I decided to get this new broom and am amazed. I was a little concerned about going with the "extra large" envisioning something huge...but the little bit of extra money for that extra space is a time saver. More floor space in less time...totally worth it. Bristles are tough, but not too tough; just right to get into corners and tight spaces. This is a great broom and worth the money.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Prompt delivery, Product and packaging is good. Love to buy it again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Do Not Buy
reviews.reviewText: This broom is much smaller than the one I ordered. I ordered the Libman 211 Extra Large Precision Angle Broom with Recycled Broom Fibers in March 2021. We loved the large size. I decided to order it again and found my original order to re-order the exact same broom again. What I received was a broom a full 4 inches shorter than the original broom. The product description says the broom is 15 inches. The broom I got was only 11 inches. I am very disappointed and unable to return it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2014
reviews.reviewText: Lightweight and wide enough to clear leaves from a path really fast. Plus I like that it's plastic; the last one I had (a smaller one, different manufacturer I think) had metal parts that rusted out, and the broom fell apart. After I'd repaired that one 2-3 times and it fell apart again in yet another place, I bought this one, which I love. I figure the plastic should last well, so long as I don't leave it out in the sun.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2020
reviews.reviewText: Its a little costly for a broom, but this is the only broom I will ever buy. Its extra wide, so you don't have to make as many passes on the floor. And its super durable.
